reviews.content: I tried to write a proper review for this movie, but I could not. Reason, I am out of words to describe this movie. From acting to direction, cinematography to background score and screenplay to the story line everything has been put in place perfectly. The message it leaves is too touching and inspiring for the audience to go back and rethink about it. I am simply amazed after watching this movie and proud that its a Bollywood product. Better late than never. Dear Hollywood,If you can give movies like "The Notebook" try "BARFI" once, I am sure the sweetness will last forever.Go and have a bite of BARFI, but be careful you may get addicted.

This is one of the worst, mind-numbing, terrible movies, I have come across in my life. Nowadays, this movie is my yardstick for rating any movie. As for example, DHOOM 3: still more original than Barfi.Those 2-2.5 hrs spent in the theater will never come back, lost in oblivion. The movie scenes were copied so blatantly from all over the world that I did not bother to pay attention to the story. To add insult to injury , this movie was the official submission from India for Academy awards. Now the whole world knows our best movies are copied. I could name the movies from which scenes have been copied , but i will not do for two reasons. First, that information is easily available, second, this movie doesn't deserve that much of my time.This movie is just a number of good scenes taken from other movies, stitched together, poorly. It was slow as hell. And the director of the movie claimed originality. The arrogance! The insult to people's intelligence! But the people liked it. So there. As long as we keep praising movies like this, nothing good and original will happen in India in any field. This movie stands for everything which is wrong with Indian education system, awareness, lack of original research, politics and many other things.

reviews.review_title: It's warm hug to all cinema lovers.
reviews.content: This director made this movie with inspired by at least 100 movies but the movie never feel too crowded. And some people say it's plagurism it's not. just because I started eating with my right hand dosen't mean I'm copying my father and even if I'm copying it is still I who is eating just like the movie The director used style of various director but the core of movie never gets corrupted.

One of the very few movies that left me speechless n completely moved. i could feel the blood through my veins go cold.! As another user has said,its a kind of movie that you can watch multiple times with diff approach eachtime.! You see it with a diffrnt mindset n it will offer u smthing diff.I cudnt stop myself from opening the notepad in my cell n writing the thoughts that gushed from within! It came from the 70mm screen n went right through to pinch the soul.!R.K.as always is just getting more versatile with each chosen script. But who took my breath away was piggy chops.! SO innocent..so tender.. So fragile.. For me c is the first actress who made me gasp a breath for her innocence.! On one side where most of them try to be glamorous, she is someone who gained respect for her simplicity.No doubt Anurag basu selected the perfect ingredients for his sweet dish!WANNA WATCH AGAIN!!!BUURRPHYYY@!

Lot of rave reviews on the movie, but I found it at best " OK/good".. not awesome or very good... One reason is - the inspirations or copying are little blatant. Like lead character mimicking scenes and body language of Charlie Chaplin and movies. Number of plots are straight lifts from "Sympathy to Mr. Vengeanace" the Korean movie.. One scene from "Notebook" and with this trend, I am sure few more "inspirations" will be evident - albeit have to look through few more world movies... But should give credit to the director for making these ideas woven well into a linear story.. The point is if you see these "inspirations" while watching, along with little predictable story-line, then you can't watch it with the interest, emotion and intrigue that are normally attached with awesome movie "watching". So for me, it made a OK watch with few smiles on some funny scenes and few smiles on the copied ideas - but strictly no other emotion evoking experience.Some more inspirations as read in various articles - benny & joon, Korean film oasis, mr. Beans holiday, project A, cops, Mr. Nobody, black cat white cat, Swedish news paper advert, the goonies, fried green tomatoes... Phew..

You may say they copied scene from others, but when they make such MASTERPEICE you should be ashamed of your perceptions and rather rephrase: they got inspired from some others. Priyanka Chopra worths every award of this earth for her role. She defied almost every grounds. I never thought she was such brilliant! She's got too much to handle. Awesome! Superb!! I'm just out of my adjectives!!! Ranbir was absolutely brilliant too. Until Priyanka came to the scene, he was blowing it up. And then Priyanka made it Grand! And together, they created one of the Best movies on the earth. Ileana is beautiful and she performed nice too. As Priyanka and Ranbir will take away all the credits, she will not be mentioned that much. But she was also mesmerizing. Anurag Basu, the director, showd some guts to draw his dream picture and let it not go away to be a lush bollywoody flick. Kudos to him. More to mention, I was also amazed how beautifully Ranbir imitated Charlie Chaplin's trademark shots! In total, Barfi! is outrageously beautiful! A full 5.00 out of 5.00 for this piece of art!!

This emotionally fantastic comedy captures the moment for viewers of most ages. It has no typical Indian fight scene where the actor beats everyone and wins and neither does it have any song with extreme dances. The songs are intertwined splendidly with the sequence of the film. Ranbir Kapoor's acting grasp's everyone. Priyanka Chopra's autistic movements where she blinks half the time she was in the pictures gives a clear view of an autistic person. Ileana D'Cruz gives a narration that would sound almost of an elderly person.It's a treat to watch and teaches everyone to take risk in life, because without taking risks, there is no meaning of life.

This movie is for perverts and airheads. In one scene Ranbir Kapoor takes out his pant pocket liner for Priyanka Chopra to hold on to on the way to the bathroom. But the camera angle makes it look like Ranbir Kapoor is sticking out his penis just before Priyanka grabs it. In another scene a fat guy is gesturing to Ranbir Kapoor to go for his lower body part. Ranbir Kapoor obliges and reaches out for the fat guys lower body only to pick up a newspaper. Enough said, this is garbage.

First thing first: Yes some scenes are blindly copied from other movies. But scenes of few minutes don't make an entire movie. What makes this film so enjoyable and at the same time brilliant is the simple yet moving story and superlative performances. No doubt Ranbir kapoor was inexplicably brilliant to an extent that his deaf and mute character made audiences speechless but it's Priyanka Chopra with her brilliant nuanced performance of an autistic woman who steals the show despite the fact that her screen-time is the shortest of all three lead actors and comparatively less massy!!! Ileana D'çruz made a mark with her Hindi debut and will go places!!!Another reason to watch Barfi is its fabulous cinematography and mesmerizing music!! Two thumbs-up for that!!Storyline was however a weakling over here with unnecessary addition of "murder mystery" plot to it which is not as interesting as meant to be.(-1 there)Nonetheless Do watch this movie which will touch your heart and will make you fall in love with life and change your perspective about it!!!Ranbir and Ileana excellent but barfi is priyanka's film all the way!!

reviews.review_title: A treat of colours, sounds and characters
reviews.content: Have you been able to look at a painting and stay amazed for a long 2&1/2 hours. I was able to do so yesterday.The painting was Anurag Basu's...BARFI.Every movement of the characters involved therein is like a painting, well created and visualised. Every movement seems like a glide over ice, the visual so calm and fresh, the music so breezy and trans like more like in french films. The accordion is used so breathtakingly well. Pritam has shown what he is actually capable of, he should stick to doing so rather than make cast-copies from other languages.Cinematography is just stunning, frames with such love and crispness. I have been wanting to go to Bengal for sometime, and now moreso after seeing the beautiful canvas shown in the movie.The Acting by Ranbir is nothing short of brilliant. So is Priyanka's who plays an autistic child, with such conviction that you would wonder was she actually a fashion queen before? All other characters involved in the movie have been played very well to the character's requirements. It may have its cartoon type moments, but the characters involved are such that it is entitled to be so.Not often are you lucky enough to have seen such movies in your lifetime, so if you get a chance to watch it, please go and do so.Director: Anurag BasuMusic: PritamCinematographer: S Ravi VarmanTrailer:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yZxrao3zou4

Already there are number of accolades about this movie. India Govt. decided to send this movie to compete in Oscars. So far rating is very high in IMDb. No doubt this is an outstanding movie and took Bollywood one step ahead in commercial segment. But in two areas the movie will not get full marks from me.1. Originality: Many of the scenes are copied from various movies. So, the great sequences are not original – rather they are picked and stitched in the movie (very well stitched though). Scenes copied from:i. Charlie Chaplin - The Adventurerii. Charlie Chaplin - City Lightsiii. The Notebookiv. Singin' in the Rainv. Buster Keaton's CopsMusic is also inspired from Amelie.2. Perfection: There are many technical issues as well in the movie which should have been avoided. For example, the age proportions of different characters were different in different times. If you take the police officer – he was not so old in last age but Barfi was too old. The makeup of Shruti in old age was not that good. There are many other technical faults as well.

reviews.review_title: Not so good as it is hyped
reviews.content: For some time, of about 20 minutes of the film you can not understand anything except a guy trying to make some comedy(but you can not sense or feel the comedy because there is no subject) like Charlie Chaplin, with a music in the back ground like Charlie Chaplin movies. What the director wants to tell the viewers nobody knows. After 20 or 30 minutes only it is got to understand about the speaking and hearing impairedness of the male lead.The only saving grace is the cinematography. amazing lighting, framing and excellent photography. probably shooting with his camera thinking he is shooting for an original piece.The music is annoying and adds nothing to the narrative what so ever. In fact it prolongs the narrative to a point whereby the stroy become like some form of slow torture.

reviews.review_title: Stupendous! Leaves you speechless, you crave for more.
reviews.content: OK. The on going trend in movies: gravity-zero kung-fu fist fights, idiotic flawed stories. In the end one thought "Oh God! I wasted my hardly earned bucks on these movies". Although, I hate watching the trendy copied albeit flawed Bollywood flicks and its been a long time when I saw a Hindi movie. But then, "barfi" arrives. The dominion of Ranbir Kapoor is still on. Although, he is no "khan" but that's a boon for him. I entered the Theater with a trauma of "Ek Tha Tiger", thinking that this movie might lead the expectations. Hall is jam-packed, people whispering their own reviews, girls starving for Ranbir, boys hooting for Ileana and between this hustle and bustle, movie begins. And it takes you away from the very first appearance of that song "Picture Shuru". The story never leaves you. Although you keep on guessing what will happen next, but you're proved wrong in the end. People compared Ranbir's performance with Chaplin and his Grand father, Raj Kapoor, but let me clear out, Ranbir is a part of their clan now. Kudos! The songs leaves you with smiley tears, Ranbir-Ileana-Priyanka's performances leaves you speechless, stunned, numb. The bitter-sweet relationships of these three beautiful young characters, Murphi aka Barfi (Ranbir Kapoor), Shruti (Ileana D'cruz) and Jhilmil (Priyanka Chopra) will not bore you out. You won't ask for an Intermission too. It will force you to say "What a brilliantly fantabulous piece of work". A movie for all. Even if this movie had no dialogs, a silent film, it would have been the same touchy flick. Warning: Not for the people who does not respect art.

In Spanish the word mirada means "the look". An unspoken telepathic bond sealed with the expression in one's eyes. Barfi! manages just that- it laces humor, love, & tragedy in a neat 2 hours & 33 minute film which leaves you blinking at people around you in the theater, every eye emoting, mouths slightly ajar in pin drop silence. & for once, the Indian audience should get an award for shushing their children and keeping their mobile phones on "silent". Ranbir Kapoor is the find of his generation. Rishi Kapoor & his son share the same charm & range, Priyanka Chopra is as flawless as ever, lighting up Jhilmil like the glowworms of the Darjeeling forest & Ileana just bends with the breeze, the best debut ever! Barfi! defines the deaf and mute boy inside him as the new normal!For once the differently abled individuals in India will receive some respect & love instead of the constant staring & murmuring! Barfi! embraces his disabilities just like the Londoners do their crazy weather!His tragic yet comic life is reminiscent of the late Charlie Chaplin. The similarity with the black & white classic ends where Barfi! finds the grey area of love.The actors have to dig deep & kudos to their acting skills that they deliver such powerhouse performances,depicting a romantic love while keeping it clean & raw at the same time.Its a continuous start-stop grinding game of tennis. RK will need a bigger trophy closet by the end of the season :) & although I don't like Barfi! ( the Indian sweet) I love Barfi! ( the movie!).
This is got to be one of the worst movies I have ever seen. One of the main characters name is literally Barfi ?! Seriously?? Priyanka must have been hard up for money when she made this movie

reviews.review_title: Most overrated movie of the year
reviews.content: Watched the movie with great expectations after I had heard a lot about it,but I must confess, Barfi is a highly overrated movie. Despite its fresh looks it lacks originality. it's heavily inspired from Charlie Chaplin movies and many of the scenes are directly copied from his movies. But I could not have a laugh at it although kids might find them comic. Movie is shot at descent locations in Indian hills in matching weather conditions. But the plot has many incidents which try to add humor quotient but fail miserably. With same story, one could have made a dramatic masterpiece with lot of emotions but writer and director chose otherwise. Coming to performances, Ranbir Kapoor has done justice to his character with descent performance, but at times it has too much caricature. Ileana looks pretty and acts well. the best performance however comes from Priyanka Chopra, she plays mentally challenged dumb girl. Her expressions are perfect for such a character and she has made it look unbelievably simple. I could not stop myself comparing her performance to Rani Mukherji's in Black, although Rani is one of my all time favorite, I have to say, Priyanka beats her hands down here. Overall Barfi is one time watch with boring first half which shapes up in second half. you can definitely watch it for Priyanka.

'Picture shuru, huyi picture shuru' Even before the film started, 'Barfi!' gave a reason to smile. In the divine settings of Darjeeling, in its narrow streets and alleyways, the ubiquitous rail lines circuiting all over the beautiful hill station and in the hearts of the simple minded residents (lucky them!), this movie had a feel good quality that leaves our heart warm and mellow. Plus, I must say, what use is a beauty if not properly captured on a photographic film? Great job done by the cinematographers!! But hadn't it been due to the stellar performances of Ranbir Kapoor and Priyanka Chopra, this movie, inspite of the picturesque settings, might have been bland and lackluster. A poignant portrayal of an autistic girl by Priyanka Chopra, I must say kudos to her acting acumen because no other actress worthy of her salt might have succeeded in doing what she had achieved. Ranbir ("Barfi!") Kapoor a.k.a. Raj Kapoor, a.k.a. Mr. Bean, achieves through his silence what the gun toting, expletive spewing and loudly guffawing protagonists (be it Salman Kan or Akshay Kumar) of Southern Replicas could not achieve - merit in their performance. Even the newbie Ileana D' Cruz fits in the shoes of Shruti Sengupta quite naturally. She is here to stay in Bollywood. But everything hinges on the shoulders of the puppeteer to see through the successful execution of the act, and to use the banal phrase, Anurag Basu (Director/Writer) is a dab hand at it! Revolving around three different timelines, Anurag Basu has succeeded in making this story seamless, which if not handled properly might have seen troubles sprouting out from every nook and cranny. Well, I won't reveal the storyline. I even hope that you won't open Wikipedia to check out the story. Because as Alfred Hitchcock said, "There is no terror in the bang, only in the anticipation of it." Of course, he meant it for spine chillers, but the message remains validated. Though slowing down a wee bit in the second half, this movie is indeed a success, as according to me it has succeeded what it has endeavored to portray, that 'Love is unadulterated, 100% pure.'

Comical and sweet film featuring love triangle of Barfi, Shruti and Jhilmil Chatterjee. The location in the movie is Darjeeling and Calcutta-beautiful scenes. Barfi is a deaf and mute protagonist who has his heart dangling between Shruti and Jhilmil. He had made the entire Darjeeling as his own circus. He keeps on running and doing adventures. While Shruti is shown as mature character who comes all the way from Calcutta to the snow town and finds her escape in Barfi's unusual yet boo boo tricks. And Jhilmil, my favorite character is played very well by Priyanka Chopra Jonas. Jhilmil is an autistic girl residing in cottage like hostel Muskaan and his Bengali father wants her to be with him in order to con out money from his family through her. Arijit Singh has played a tuneful song Phir Le Aya Dil in which three of the characters has been shown together enjoying their life. Happily. A perfect song of successful love triangle. Overall good film. Barfi is a milk sweet but Barfi with exclamation mark is a whole new experience, sweeter than the uncoded Barfi ;).

Barfi is already a commercial success. Ranbir's act is praiseworthy even though he himself confessed its inspired from Charlie Chaplin, Raj Kapoor and Mr. Bean. Ranbir has a screen presence like his predecessors of Kapoor clan. Priyanka Chopra as jhilmil was simply amazing. Bravo PC! Ileana D'cruz looks nice, acting was not bad.The cinematography is beautiful and so are the locations of Darjeeling and Kolkata. Anurag Basu's direction is OK though better than his last movie Kites. Music by Pritam is a treat . In newspapers there was an article of 3 major scenes of Barfi being copied from Hollywood classics. Wonder how they chose it for Oscar! Even keeping this flaw aside, I found the screenplay to be very tedious. Slow enough to make me yawn thrice. Barfi amused me in parts, especially the first half. For me its a one time watch. Watch it for the good performances.

barfi is an excellent movie although i watched it in a bad print.the story and specially the acting of ranbir kapoor and priyanka chopra was so wonderful that i was thinking how they both managed to be like that,it was really a difficult task.. a perfect romance and a perfect comedy i can say... the story is not only interesting but an intelligent one also.. like the bell and fan connection.iliena an upcoming actress also did a wonderful job.after a long time period since 3 idiots was released i saw a professional comedy "barfi". i have seen it three times and now i m gonna watch it for the fourth time.. must watch it 10/10....

It's hard to say if the movie will cross the 100C mark on opening weekend to pay the Mufphy radio (which sued them for using their name in the movie) as there are no robots or dabbangs in the movie. It's an emotionally crafted beautiful love triangle between a deafndumb, autistic person and a rich married girl in beautiful hill-station.This movie reminds me of watching Charlie Chaplin except that it's in color n has Ranbir who gave a decent performance. Priyanka was again at her best and Illeana with her cute smile in black dress won many hearts n her performance shows why she is one of the top tollywood actor.Pritam's music compliments the movie which has not many words in it. Anurag Basu made the funny scenes look funnier n emotional scenes touchy. On the whole the movie is a national award puller n hope it gives new direction to Bollywood industry.

Being a strong critic of Bollywood Cinema, Barfi! strikes me like a wave of refreshment. A very positive attitude, while crafting this kind of cinematic experience, is required, and the team of Barfi did it in its own unique flair. Aside from the effortless performances by all the actors, Anurag Basu has shown his true qualities: the notion of freedom in creating cinematic art. He, at this time perhaps, didn't aim at commercialization and produced a movie of this status. I believe when you go inside the theater expecting some art, all other crass movies but Burfi disappoint you. It is therefore, the success of Barfi lies in redefining the true meaning of Cinema and the experience associated with it. I grew up listening to people surrounding me that the old-age cinema used to be better than we happen to see today. I think I got the reason behind the saying earlier, and now Burfi marked its stamp on this legitimate reasoning. At that period of time, filmmakers believed in Cinema, not in money. They drew passion, motivation from the art itself. After all, art should be preserved in its true form, and with the likes of Barfi Anurag Basu, in my opinion, pays due homage to Cinematic art. There are references to the vintage movies of the likes of Charlie Chaplin, Italian Cinema which is light hearted in its core. Moreover, the movie didn't lake Bollywood taste, yet it tried to be indifferent towards the same--perhaps a positive aspect for it.Every scene in this movie craved for perfection; the team of barfi tried their best to keep it near perfect. Well, there is also scope of improvement in every thing, hence the case goes with Burfi too. It's length might be one area: if it had been shorter by 10-15 minutes, the movie would have been better than the present form. On the other hand, music was superb. Pritam shined and filled the movie with 70's aura.Overall, one should watch it for the love of cinematic art. Ranbir Kapoor seemed to have an eclectic taste and surely he reminds us of The Showman, Mr. Raj Kapoor. Priyanka Chopra did her part without having her noticed in this movie. You see only the characters in the movie. Illiana was truly amazing in her portrayal of Bengali housewife. Rest of the cast delivered what was required: neither more nor less.

reviews.review_title: Great Love Story after a long time
reviews.content: Barfi- When someone makes a movie with lot of love, it shows. In Barfi, it shines and mesmerizes. I think few weeks ago I mentioned on this forum that long time Bollywood created a movie that makes your heart go mushy and achy. The ones that make you ask where has that kind of love gone? And With Barfi, I think the prayer was answered. As we have already read multiple reviews about it Barfi, lot of good and couple of average, hence I would be just brief about my thoughts here. 1. Many lump-in-throat moments. Not detailing where all to not to spoil for others who have not yet seen . But I was feeling so good every time a tear came in my eyes or my throat formed a lump. Long time since I got moved with a scene from Bollywood. 2. Ranbir can easily be crowned the typical romantic hero of these times who can deliver the innocence of selfless lover to the T (APKGK, Rockstar, Barfi) and you can't but help comparing this ordinary boyish charm with his ancestors Raj Kapoor and Shammi Kapur. And boy, he looks dishy in many scenes when he falls in love with EDC. 3. Priyanka lived her character of a "Pure as a Dew Drop Jhilmil" to perfection. Her eyes, gestures, whole personality oozed of innocence and uncorrupted waif. Hats off and serious competition to VB at Awards nights! 4. Ileana couldn't choose a better movie to debut in Bollywood and hopefully goes on to make it big. Coming to few things that I read in reviews and my thoughts on that:  Length of movie- Many ppl said it shud have been short by 30-40 mints or 1 hour, but I am not complaining. If people can sit through the likes of Joker, Ready, Body Guard, Jism 2 etc no one shall complain about a good movie being long which is nothing short of fresh air. I can understand director's dilemma here, when the movie is made with too much love and is about small slice of life moments, it's very difficult to cut any part of it without regrets. Even Life is Beautiful and Forrest Gump were 2+ hours instead of usual 1.5 hours of Hollywood standards and no complaints.  Songs and Cinematography – The look and sound of music took me back to the era of 1942-a Love Story and Kareeb. The same magical scenic surroundings and music that just swept you away on a long ride to dreamy romance and beauty of normal innocence of life. Full Marks to both.  Make up- While the 70s make up was great, the present day Elderly characters' get up left lot to be desired. Wish more effort could be put on that department. I would have no complaints if some other Senior Citizen actors would have played elderly Barfi/Jhilmil/Shruti. But this drawback is forgotten and forgiven quickly keeping in mind what good stuff you observed just now.
A very well adoption of the notebook. great performance as well as direction with emotions and laughs at the same time!

The movie begins with a leg-pulling jingle advising audience to settle down properly. Then begins a flashback story, there are two flashbacks actually. One by Shruti (Ileana D'cruz) and other by inspector (Saurabh Shukla). Story is set in Locales of Darjeeling and Kolkatta.The unconventional story of Barfi (Ranbir Kapoor) is told with a conventional panache. The tellers spell out his characteristic of enjoying every moment of life and living it to the maximum, despite of his shortcomings of not being able to speak or hear. The name "Barfi" was originally christened as "Murphy" after the radio-sets (carrying image of a cute baby) people used to have in 70s. But as Barfi himself could not speak his name, it sounded more like Barfi, the sweet.Jhilmil Singh (Priyanka Chopra) enters little late in the movie as a girl growing up with Autism and facing backlash from society.Story revolves around three youngsters who realise that love as a feeling cant be ignored or modified. No matter how they try to avoid Love, it comes back to them. How story steps out of ordinary is the harsh reality of the much touted 'second chance' people get in life. Story supports the second chance concept, however also emphasizes on the 'time' when you take/get it.There is a point towards the end when Shruti spells out her illusive dream of a love story where she ( epitomising her grandmother) will find Mr. Right and grow old with him. She compares her stand about Mr. Barfi with Jhilmil who unlike her did not put brain while getting involved with Barfi and continues to do so for the rest of her life.Ranbir and Priyanka have given their best performances ever. They seem to sink into the characters so well, especially Priyanka when she makes audiences forget what model actress she is. The supporting cast by Saurabh Shukla and Ashish Vidyarthi are stupendous. We wonder why Priyanka is virtually missing out in publicity posters, its definitely an Oscar performance by her as well as Ranbir. Ileana works her way out with the stills pretty well. All in all a very fulfilling experience. Full bang for the buck.

reviews.review_title: invest a bit of patience, you will be paid with incredibly happy emotions
reviews.content: Item number, mass masala fights, powerful dialogs, duets with heroines, bare-bodies, hot scenes. Tare zameen par might be the last movie (now Barfi) that I have watched without any of above mentioned so called commercial elements of Indian cinema. Barfi, can certainly be a classic. After the movie, you do not remember story or scenes, only characters emotions. Every character is a portrayal of emotions, from Barfi to policeman. You do not realize the disability of lead pair, you only feel love for each other. For sure you will watch climax again and again.Though movie stands as a respectable film, some scenes were lifted from famous Charlie Chaplin comedies (Police door sliding scene, see-saw with ladder on wall, Barfi wakes up on inaugural statue scene). Invest a bit of patience, you will be paid with a powerful emotion of happiness.

I'm not very fond of Bollywood movies but I don't mind watching the good ones either! This time, most of the theaters were house-full for a few days! I watched a DVDscr rip and I was happy that I didn't have to spend money...to me, watching the movie matters, not where I watch it!Now, coming to the movie, it was very well woven and everything was awesome. The acting, songs, direction..everything! The movie is realistic, funny and emotional. Ranbir, Ileana and Priyanka were all very good. They portrayed their characters perfectly! It is touching to see that even invalids can have a life. They can fall in love and maintain it too! I liked the idea of couples "dying" together. It's very classic and the love story is not like the modern day definition of "love".One small drawback that I found is that the movie is very sluggish and slow. It is not a problem as enjoying the movie is more important! Very good movie! If you can't watch it in a theater, watch it on your computer at least! ;)
I loved the acting of whole cast. Really enjoyed the comedy and songs. Watched it so many times

reviews.review_title: Not sure what the "story" was about..
reviews.content: I had very high expectations from this movie as it made it to the Oscars and had a rating of 9.1 on IMDb. Words cannot described how disappointed I was. I really don't get the hype and the 10/10 ratings by users. Have they ever seen a good movie? A movie is not good because of its effects . Its not good because the director includes too many random funny scenes which don't really advance the story. And its certainly not good when the few good scenes are actually copied(please don't even try to argue by saying "inspired") from several films.Its good because of the acting and an actual plot. Whatever "plot" was there it was so weak and felt like Anuruag just added it as an extra. I thought this movie would be emotional and about how handicapped people are treated and their struggles. Initially it felt like a comedy,then an adventure story, then a love story and towards the end a mystery. At times I even wondered if this film was aimed at children. I believe the director himself had no clear idea what his film was supposed to be about. Now to the acting. Illeana and Ranbir were great.Priyanka's acting however seemed as if she was trying too hard and was not very comfortable in her role. Her constant blinking and eye twitching were just annoying,and it did not seem at all natural.I never felt emotional at any of the scenes nor connected with any of the characters. The movie as a whole was extremely boring and annoying. Forget about saving your money on movie tickets, don't even watch it on DVD or online for free.

There are very few movies which can create an impression with simplicity. Well, this movie does more than that !Movies now a days rely on nudism, double entendre duologue's, item-numbers or Khan power to entertain masses. reviews.review_title: Barfi speaks to the viewers straight from heart. In this world of Barfi there is no place for ego and prejudice, but for purity and innocence from where real love sprouts.
reviews.content: Somebody once quoted - "Life through a child's eyes is the most precious way to live." This life is what Anurag Basu has visualized for us in Barfi, a film which teaches us to make the biggest decisions of life through heart and not through brain.Barfi is truly a director's movie. Though I cannot think of any actor other than Ranbir to play the subtle character of Barfi, I still claim that the movie belongs to Anurag Basu, the Bengali director who ignited our senses with the sensuous Murder. This movie reflects the rising graph of Basu who scintillated the Indian viewers with Murder and Gangster where emotions and personal vendetta played the lead roles. Post Gangster, he entered the world of parody where he showcased the hollow emotions of the fast paced metro dwellers in Life In Metro. His next venture was Kites which was a romantic thriller, a less experimented genre in Bollywood, was surrounded by more hype than substance. His latest move,Barfi, turns out to be the best out of his kitty which establishes himself as one of the most promising directors in Bollywood. The movie portrays Basu's spiritual and philosophical thought process which might have been a consequence of the life threatening leukemia in his life. His graduation is very evident in his movies.From loud emotions like anger and revenge, he moves to social sarcasm from where he tries out romance of the hearts to finally land up in a movie which explores personal philosophies. Now it would be very interesting to see what is Basu up to in his next movie.To talk about the movie - I know that lots and lots had been talked, praised and ridiculed about the movie. The movie got into the limelight by its heartwarming story-line, the non-linear-but-candid screenplay, wonderful music from Pritham and exceptional performances by its lead actors - Ranbir, Priyanka and Ileana. It also received some blunt criticism because of the allegations of copying scenes from foreign movies including those of Chaplin. However as far as I am concerned the movie fulfilled its purpose.The movie is all about three characters - Barfi (a deaf and mute guy who sees life through a child's eye), Shruti (the Bengali bubbly girl who strikes Brafi with her beautiful smile, played by Ileana) and Jhilmil (the autistic girl who loved and trusted Barfi beyond doubts, played by Priyanka). The whole story revolves around the emotional tangles which each character sets for the other and how they breaks it. The movie might have been inspired from some other theme and may not be labeled original. Nonetheless, the film succeeds to converse directly to the viewer's heart. There are some lovely scenes in the movie which make you fall in love with the characters. I would want to quote one sequence here - Barfi, after befriending with people, takes them to a place where there is a lamppost. The lamppost is built out of wood and is very fragile. Barfi will cut the lamppost at a particular angle and he clearly knows where it will fall. He then clasps his friends' hands and stand in front of the lamppost. His friends will get concerned and they will move away from Barfi fearing that the post may fall upon them. But Barfi remains still as he clearly knows at what length and angle the post will fall and it will not touch him. This is an exercise he does with all of his friends. It can be touted as a funny act from Barfi or one which tests his friends' trust in him. He chooses to leave Shruti and live with Jhilmil performing this simple act. When Shruti moves away from him after he cuts the post, Jhilmil allows him to clasp her hand and hold her firm. She believes in him and trusts him. She doesn't try to judge him while others do. Barfi tries to establish that love cannot be defined within the conventions of society. It shows that love is the language of hearts and transcends norms and customs to a world where purity and innocence dwells. There is no place for ego or prejudice in this world.To me, a movie succeeds if it remains in my mind at least for a day after watching it. Measuring Barfi in terms of that, I can easily say that this movie is more than a mere success. It is here to stay. (I regret of not watching Barfi in the cinemas. If I would have, then this review would have happened one year back.)

Barfi will not only steal your heart away but keep you wanting more by which time its starts drawing out in the latter half. The movie gets off as characters surrounding Barfi narrates his time line unfolding in an otherwise sleepy, misty town in Darjeeling. Barfi's antics invigorates the town and its people even if its not entirely in favor of protagonist.Ranbir Kapoor excels the dumb and deaf, cute, Barfi to perfection, and it would have hardly mattered to the audience that the whole movie was cut into pieces and shuffled together (director was trying to be innovative?Yikes!), as the audience goes into raptures of heartfelt laughter. Ranbir's youthful energy is infused into the story realm. Without Barfi's playful antics instilling the town with a soul of its own, she would be overwhelmed by the greed its people would go to any lengths for. Adding to the coziness of the viewer, the town ages into the present world along with Barfi. The audience is witnessed to the hippie, playfully shy town represented in the 1970's 'Murphy' radio billboard adverts giving way to present day underwear advertisements in shamelessly larger view of arriving city tourists. Almost equally well played, Priyanka Chopra leaves behind her flashy 'Fashion' wardrobe untouched this time as she plays a mentally retarded (by credits I realize she was playing an autistic kid), Jhilmil, who yearns for care and love after she's plucked from her institutional home to fulfill her Grandpa's last dying wish. After grandpa's death Jhilmil finds it hard to fit in her home and finds solace and unconditional love in an unassuming Barfi.The moments between Priyanka and Ranbir will melt the hearts of lady folk but don't quite stick by the end of the movie.Forget that you are reminded of Charlie Chaplin's antics (it should be taken as tribute rather.. to the King of Comedy) or you would do well not watch the copies from which Barfi is allegedly and ruthlessly taken from - Not seen for a long time in Bollywood, Barfi! will fill you with a heart-full of warmth and happiness and leave you smiling all the way home.Go watch 'Barfi!'...Be Barfi for a while.

reviews.review_title: It calls out to your mind and heart. It captures your sight and you can't let go!
reviews.content: I have not, in recent memory, seen a more beautiful, intelligent and original piece of work in Hindi cinema, save for 3 Idiots in 2009. When you walk into a cinema, you are looking to be entertained and that's what Barfi does surprisingly though you can walk in with all your good senses in tact (for a Bollywood movie yes!) as Barfi invites you to explore life , learn it's lessons, feel the pain and then know how to move on. You are shown how to laugh or to express love or sorrow or hurt in the face of cold indifference. The performances are brilliant, the cinematography is masterful and the directing lies at the heart of it all.No character is bigger than the movie and that's where Anurag Basu shines through. His craft ensures that the audience grasps the sheer irony of life which is expressed through performances yes, but also through depiction of sheer poverty, helplessness, losses and survival. No where in the movie do you realize that the movie is tethering you towards it's own conclusions. You don't realize that it's speaking to your subconscious mind and bringing to you beauty lost with images,sights,sounds,speech,experiences, which you take for granted may be a million times in a day. As the story unfolds, you indulge in a lost world of expressions and fearlessness and start to appreciate the many joys you choose to ignore on an everyday basis.I know I could find one tiny loose-end in one of the scenes but the movie is so hauntingly beautiful that it'd be a crime to even linger on "finding flaws". I do not think Barfi! could be outclassed in a few years to come. It stands chest-to-chest with some of the cinematic giants from the 80's and before, It is from the league of Aamir Khan and all those who'd be compared with Barfi! would deem it the highest privilege.Please watch it.

Sometimes, when you least expect it, something comes along and touches you in a special way. Barfi is exactly that bolt out of the blue. Walking in, not sure what to expect, a comedy or an overdone dose of tear jerking tactics based on physical limitations - I came out happy to be proved wrong. While as a usual Virgo perfectionist, I could choose to pick holes in the story - I really think this movie went beyond the usual 5 point scale of greatness. Somehow reminds me of how sometimes we try and grade movies with the head rather than the heart. And like Robin Williams in Dead Poets Society - for today, lets rip out the page which grades poetry/movies on an x/y scale. Our hearts live on emotions and feelings and graphs don't really do those well. For me- Anurag Basu has created his masterpiece and shared it with us. He had me in tears at so many moments (and I can feel them coming back now as I think of some of them). The performances of Ranbir, Illeana and most of all Priyanka created an afternoon of magic for me which the ticket price will never justify! The tossing of the shoes in the air, Priyanka's calls of "Brrfii" and Illeana's always being there at Ranbir's weakest moments are just some of those. I loved the poignancy created by watching Ranbir getting Priyanka to say "Namaste" to Illeana, or Illeana's stopping when she heard Priyanka call out to Ranbir - even though she knew she was giving away all she wanted for his happiness, Priyanka's lying down near Ranbir at the end, Priyanka's passing Ranbir's loyalty test of the street lamp - all these were just moments which I couldn't help being touched by (even when I think of them as I write this now).The great strength of this movie was the fact that Basu chose to ignore the beaten track of using the character's limitations to build sympathy, but rather made them into characters who live a normal life and face the same challenges just as anyone else in the world. The narrative is lucid and takes us through the intermingling trail of their lives and decisions and leaves us asking of ourselves questions which perhaps we may more often choose to ignore rather than answer. The performances were spectacular by way of simplicity. Ranbir and Priyanka both ran the risk of overdoing the focus on their limitations, however they both emerge as characters who may well overshadow their other performances. Illeana was elegant and simple and brought the demands of society and actions under the same to the forth. Her performance was brilliant and an excellent support foil for Ranbir and Priyanka. To my mind, Priyanka was mind blowing. The usually glamorous girl in most roles has shown depth in her performance and I for one fell in love with "Jhilmil". Her role as an autistic was brilliantly done, the specialists may choose to find flaws with some aspects but I'm not one of them. Her wonder-struck looks and expressions of happiness throughout the movie had me completely spellbound. Ranbir again shows he has come of age and I look forward to him in many more roles off the usual commercial formula pieces. I am very sure his rendition of the smile creation with his hand will catch on in the next few days but more than that I do hope his approach to life and endless endeavors to create magical and happy moments is remembered. The support cast did just what was needed - to me it was perfectly orchestrated and for that Basu needs the entire credit. The packaging was excellent and made for brilliant cinematic viewing. All in all - if you are thinking about watching it, stop thinking and watch it - it could well be some of the best viewing moments of your life. It was for me. Barfi touched me in a very special manner, I hope it does the same for you.

reviews.review_title: Barfi! leaves you speechless...much like its hero

It's also the only film to have gotten a STANDING OVATION at the theater, and i saw all of them at the theater.The film is a gem of all types be it the the unique intro, or the first frame whose tenderness sets you up for the ride. A love story at its core, the movie is unique in that it showcases each person's love story on its own strength, separately yet intertwined and does so fantastically. It also holds out the promise of finding new love after losing while conceding that some memories will always be looked back upon with regret.Ranbir is brilliant, his performance the most heart moving since that of Aamir Khan and Darsheel in Taare Zameen Par. She absolutely steals the show all the way here. Each and every frame of hers is brilliant that it leaves you wondering why she's not mentioned along with Vidya Balan and Kareena more often in the list of female leads who can act and outperform anyone. To say anything else is to do injustice .Finally to Anurag Basu, you surely deserve an Oscar nomination for this work and for coming the way you did after Kites. reviews.review_title: A Movie With a Lot of Heart
reviews.content: This is a movie you CANNOT hate. A movie where the protagonists are handicapped comes with a risk of unnecessary melodrama. Barfi! steers clear of this path and Basu manages to entertain the audience with really engaging scenes.The story is more or less a look back on the life of Barfi (Ranbir Kapoor) by Shruti (Illeana D'Cruz) and a Sub-Inspector (Saurabh Shukla). Barfi's relationship with Shruti and Jhilmil (Priyanka Chopra) is looked into and it also has an crime investigation flavor to it (which makes it a wee bit more interesting). How Barfi goes through his life from 1972 to 1978 (Darjeeling - Kolkata) is pretty much the movie. It has twists which are quite subtle.Anurag Basu has been very true to the movie. He has put a lot of heart to each of the scenes. Sometimes he has been really over-indulgent which drags the movie, especially in the first half. The movie is at least 20 minutes too long. Some cruelty with the scissors would have made the movie crisper and more enjoyable.The biggest positive to me was the utterly stunning camera-work (S. Ravi Varman). The landscape shots and the clever use of focus was fabulous. Really loved the feel of the small town and the countryside. The background score was fantastic as well - never intrusive yet always adding to the situation. Must give credit to Pritam (assuming it is not lifted) Ranbir Kapoor has put in an excellent performance. There are some solo acts within the movie where he really proves his mettle. You cannot help but feel what he is trying to make the character in the movie feel. Priyanka Chopra is also very good in her role; you do pity her character. This is a seriously courageous performance from both. Very few leading actors would embarrass themselves for their characters. Respect!Ileana D'Cruz and Saurabh Shukla play regular people but do put up very competent performances. Illeana showcases a range of emotions in the movie very well, but it will surely be overshadowed by Ranbir and Priyanka purely because of the nature of their characters. The rest of the cast do their job quite well.All in all, it is a thoroughly enjoyable movie. It doesn't make much of a point, though I doubt if that was the intention anyway. I suggest you watch this movie when you are in a fairly relaxed and patient mood. Bollywood producing cinema of this quality is rare.EDIT: Since the review, I have learnt that fair number of scenes were copied and so was the background score. I have cut a point for that. That however should not make the movie any less watchable.

reviews.content: BEAUTIFUL movie. Unique direction and use of multiple flashbacks. The use of flashbacks may be compared to Leonardo's Inception. It strongly binds a viewer at every moment. The beauty of life is presented at every aspect of the movie. It strongly and deeply speaks that life is a festival... for each and every one.. no matter what is going on in his/her life.. difficulties are to come for sure... different difficulties in different forms for different people.. but all these (so called) troubles cannot stop one from enjoying life.. OR may be enjoying those troubles as well.. The hero of movie, Murphy (or Barfi) truly dances with life.. throughout his life..Love and marriage generally seen in the present society (which may be for good or bad??) is beautifully projected. And the best projection of a TRUE LOVE where only heart matters and mind in the long run only servers the heart to manage all other life needs. Thank you Anurag Basu..

I don't know much about the fuss people are making about how some scenes are copied, nor do I care much, what I know is that I watched the movie right after watching 'Identity Thief' and it made it look like a huge waste of time and computer battery! I was too drown in the original story of the movie, which is beautiful beyond all words, to notice or fuss about 'copied' scenes... I gave the movie a ten, only because there was no higher. It was a perfect combination of humour, romance and drama. It's the kind of movie that gets to you. It teaches us that some feelings need not be about perfection in others, it is their imperfections that we should embrace and cherish. If we keep looking for 'a perfect' other, if we give up what we have for what we might have, we may end alone; that's what happened to Shruti. As for Barfi and Jhilmil, you just cannot escape the 'beauty' of how it all came to be. Barfi went from the person who hits his head against the wall for being stuck with Jhilmil, to the one who would do anything to have her back. She was as disabled as he was, as imperfect as he was, yet it never stopped from sharing what she has with him; she taught him how to write his name, he taught her to spit melon seeds on the window and they had such much fun doing it. It was Jhilmil, not the beautiful Shruti, not his best friend, who was still standing there by his side when he gave his 'fidelity test'... It hit him that moment, as it hit us too: This is all that matters!People just need to learn how to enjoy things, and see the perfection that lies beyond the imperfections!

Barfi, Barfi, Barfi...There is so much I want to say about this film. I am not a native of India, but I love this film. This film is universal. At a time when we have shows like American Horror Story, Make It or Break It, and the Secret Life of American Teenager that feature characters with Down Syndrome or a physical disability, it's high time we have more films from all cultures that feature people from ALL walks of life in mainstream media. The timing couldn't be greater; more young people are being exposed to stories like this that reaffirms that we all may be different in some ways, but we seek love and acceptance all the same. I've always been a fan of Bollywood films...this one in particular made me laugh and cry and encourage me to further my studies in Sign Language. I personally want to educate myself in the multiple ways we can communicate with one another...and this film showcases how the spoken language is not the only form we can communicate love, desire, understanding, and compassion. It also does a good job of showing how we can preserver from all kinds of obstacles and still find life full of joy and adventure.The cinematography is breathtaking. It is beautifully styled and edited. And not enough could be said about the musical score that pairs so well with the art direction of the film. The actors who played their respective roles do so with a lot of heart that can be easily be seen and appreciated. When I did my research to see what others have said on the film, I was surprised by what the naysayers had to say. They nit-picked on the most obscure points...Yes, the director stated that this film is inspired by Keaton & Chaplin and other...how is that a negative?? So many films out there are inspired by others...and so many films are UNINSPIRED, poorly acted, edited, and so on...Whatever his inspirations were, this film is original to me...So lastly I want to say, do give this film a viewing. Like the rest of us, you'll surely be touched by this precious film. I enjoyed viewing it alone, but I think this film is best viewed with friends and family.

Barfi shows clear signs that Bollywood is diversifying and maturing as a film industry. It is nice to see new ideas explored, rather than dance routines and over-the top drama. The tired Bollywood formulae is becoming an absolute bore to watch, as I have seen it plenty of times. Barfi is a fresh breath of air. It is a charming and delighful piece of film-makingThe storyline takes us on the journey to the 1970s India. The costumes, background and fashion are in line with the 70s decade. The director has done a great job in direction and cinemagraphy. I like the peaceful settings. As suggested by the title, Barfi is the main character. He is a young man who cannot speak or hear. I found the character engaging. He is always in trouble with the law, as he is up to some mischief. The comedy elements between the police and Barfi features as few of the scenes throughout the film. There is a bit of the old slapstick comedy in those moments. Barfi is a cheerful person and likes to have a good laugh. There is always pressure and high expectation to live up to the name and reputation of a legendary actor (Rishi Kapoor). He is a well established actor in the industry. Acting is in genes of the Kapoor family, as Ranbir displays a wonderful performance. He has really got into the mindset of the character. I admire Ranbir modesty about his success and he deserves an award for an excellent performance as Barfi. Priyanka Chopra's character as Jhilmil is well sketched, as an autistic childhood friend of Barfi. Priyanka is a much improved actress since earlier films I have watched featuring the star. There is romance blossoming between the two. It is really sweet to admire. Bollywood newcomer IIeana plasy her part beautifully as Barfi's first love on sight.I think the characters steal the show. There is a sweet tale in the story. The films convey an important message about life. I thoroughly enjoyed Barfi. I cannot fault the film at all. I did not want the film to end at any point. It is absorbing, engaging and filled with joy. Bollywood needs to keep it up in delivering quality films like this.

I was excited to see this movie right from the first trailer released, I had a big hope. And well, this is the best Hindi movie I have ever seen. This movie is just perfect. Perfect on Story, Emotion, Drama and Acting.Anurag Basu is at his best. A movie like this was a great risk after Anurag's last movie 'Kites'. But hey, it has actually paid off. This is the kind of movie people wants to see, a PERFECT STORY..! Anurag has written and directed this movie so brilliantly, you hardly find any flaws. The moment the movie starts, there is a smile on your face. That's a job done by a song which is funny, humorous and brilliant. Now that's creativity, that's the first impression that directors should give the audience. The whole movie is so well balanced with emotions, everything is well placed.Ranbir kapoor is back with an amazing performance after Rockstar. He is so convincing in his character. In his last movie all that he did was scream his lung out, in this he doesn't say a word an yet he says a lot. He has always had to face lots of problems.A Deaf and Dumb person from birth, his mother dies after his birth and his dad a driver dies later in the movie because of Kidney failure, the girl whom he loved gets married to a guy from her college. The funniest part is how he test his friendship, that's something I would like to try with my friends. You instantly get attached to the character, his sadness and happiness is your. I am not an emotional person, but yeah that's how I felt towards the character. There is so much to learn from him.Priyanka chopra playing the character who's is suffering from Autism. I had no idea that Priyanka can act so well, she is very good in what she does in this movie. You will forget the glamorous and sexy girl that she is. She is sent to a center where people like her is taken care of. She knows Barfi from her childhood, they share a beautiful relationship. It's a relationship that nobody can explain. Brilliant performance by her.Illeana is spectacular in her first bollywood movie. She has done very well in South Indian movies, now it's time for to shine in Bollywood. She is the girl that Barfi falls in love with. He approaches her is a very impressive way. She slowly falls for him, but it's too late by the time she realizes that. She gets married to the guy from her college. After 6years of her marriage she meets Barfi again, and with a new hope to get him back in her life.Music is by Pritam. His music is always great, I like his music very much. So had lots of expectations from him, and yeah he din't disappoint. He made song that improves the movie in every way possible. Every song in the movie is amazing, melodious, it tells so much about the movie and the characters. My personal favorite song is 'Aashiyaan'.On the whole, the movie is very brilliant, realistic and inspiring. It's a kind of movie i want to watch again and again. If you are in love this is the movie u want to watch with your partner.

All the credit goes to Lead Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Priyanka Chopra and Director Anurag Basu for making this film a 100-crore blockbuster. This film will definitely make you laugh, cry, feel free and much more. Moreover, this is a type of movie which you can watch with family, friends and anyone. Since this is a romantic movie so couples can also enjoy watching it. "Barfi!," from directing to cinematography to editing, is well put together, especially for an Indian movie. I really enjoy how the film tends to focus on the positive as opposed to all the melodrama. Yes, it does get melodramatic, but not for too long. We get some beautiful shots of the scenery, but what would a technically sound film be without a script? This film has top notch writing with interesting characters and a sweet story that will melt the coldest of hearts. The story is pretty simple, but it is done in a unique way. There is minimal dialogue and most of it is conveyed through action, sort of like classic movies of the past. It's cute and adds to the overall charm of the film. However, the story is over complicated by some contrived plot points. One in particular happens towards the end of the film, but for the most part it doesn't take away much from the film. Another issue would be with how the story is told, at times it gets confusing because it jumps from brief moments of three different time periods. Even with some of these issues the film manages to come through with a sweet, touching, and charming story.

Acting is top tier for the most part. Ranbir Kapoor proves yet again that he is the new leading man in Indian cinema. His performance of Barfi is touching yet subtle. He has a sense of charm and charisma that bleeds onto the screen. No matter what the character is doing, you can't help, but love him. Priyanka Chopra gives a career transforming performance. She's usually known as the beauty queen, but here she shows a lot of depth and understanding for her autistic character. I couldn't believe that this is the same person. The rest of the cast is good, but the one to look out for is Ileana D'Cruz, who made her Bollywood debut. Her character is emotionally disturbed and indecisive. She's likable and we can root for her.

The score and songs for this film are great as well. The score has a upbeat style to it that at the same time feels whimsical. It brings you back to an era of your own youth. The songs are equally as good. They are fun and super catchy. They drive their respective scene along and it helps glide over some of the melodramatic moments.

Overall "Barfi!" is a fun and entertaining flick with a lot of heart. The story is well told and fairly original. The cast of characters are colorful and their respective actors do justice to their complex roles. Music is a driving force for this film and aids in each scene.  While the movie can get confusing and the third act feels a bit contrived, the film's charm and sweetness more than makes up for it. I give it 4/5, There's enough entertainment and lovable moments to overlook any missteps.

Sweet charm, but has drastic tonal shifts that will leave you airsick.  So this is about a young man, who is both deaf and mute, on his search for love, only it may not turn out how you think.  While I am still looking for a Bollywood movie that I am head over heels for, this is definitely one of the better ones I have seen.  I watched this in two different parts, as there is an intermission, and I think that helped to improve my opinion of it; ultimately, it is a sweet story, and it's difficult not to be won over by it.  What I did like about it was the lead, as played by Ranbir Kapoor.  He brings a lot of charisma to the table without talking, and they pull off a lot of stunts that are akin to those of the silent era of film, and they really work.  It would have helped in a number of spots if I had any familiarity with sign language; you can get the gist of what is being communicated when they are utilizing it, but it is just like watching a foreign movie without subtitles.  Where Barfi constantly lost me is that it has these wacky, goofy scenes all played for laughs right next to these serious scenes about autism, and they don't really fit together.  It even reaches the point where the silly seeps into the serious, like our main character walking into a door after some stuff just went down, and it did get in the way of my enjoyment of the film.  It is also the type of movie where if you changed the music for any given scene, it would completely change the context of the entire story.  Still, it did finish off on a note that I genuinely loved, and I walked away feeling much more positive than negative.
Finally a movie where a differently abled character is not shown as a saint, an always do-gooder and is having fun with his life. Very nicely done.
